div.p: A new approach to dimension theory, based on notions of extension types of complexes and extension dimension leads to appearence of [L]delimited-[]ğ¿OPEN:[ italic-L CLOSE:][L]-homotopy theory which, in turn, allows to introduce [L]delimited-[]ğ¿OPEN:[ italic-L CLOSE:][L]-homotopy groups (see [1]). Perhaps the most natural problem related to [L]delimited-[]ğ¿OPEN:[ italic-L CLOSE:][L]-homotopy groups is a problem of computation. It is necessary to point out that [L]delimited-[]ğ¿OPEN:[ italic-L CLOSE:][L]-homotopy groups may differ from usual homotopy groups even for complexes.

More specifically the problem of computation can be stated as follows: describe [L]delimited-[]ğ¿OPEN:[ italic-L CLOSE:][L]-homotopy groups of a space Xğ‘‹italic-XX in terms of usual homotopy groups of Xğ‘‹italic-XX and homotopy properties of complex Lğ¿italic-LL.

The first step on this way is apparently computation of nğ‘›italic-nn-th [L]delimited-[]ğ¿OPEN:[ italic-L CLOSE:][L]-homotopy group of Snsuperscriptğ‘†ğ‘›italic-S POSTSUPERSCRIPT:start italic-n POSTSUPERSCRIPT:endS^{n} for complex whose extension type lies between extension types of Snsuperscriptğ‘†ğ‘›italic-S POSTSUPERSCRIPT:start italic-n POSTSUPERSCRIPT:endS^{n} and Sn+1superscriptğ‘†ğ‘›1italic-S POSTSUPERSCRIPT:start italic-n ADDOP:plus NUMBER:1 POSTSUPERSCRIPT:endS^{n+1}.
In what follows we, in particular, perform this step.

Follow [1], we introduce notions of extension types of complexes, extension dimension, [L]delimited-[]ğ¿OPEN:[ italic-L CLOSE:][L]-homotopy, [L]delimited-[]ğ¿OPEN:[ italic-L CLOSE:][L]-homotopy groups and other related notions.
We also state Dranishnikovâ€™s theorem, characterizing extension properties of complex [2].
